sense.name: a solid 3D object with rectangular sides
sense.examples: The child played with building blocks. Sally put a new block of soap by the bathtub. He carved a statue from the block of marble. The sprinter placed his foot against the starting block in preparation for the race. Mary used a chopping block to cut up the vegetables for the stew. There were blocks of ice floating in the river this morning.

sense.name: an area in a town or city bounded by streets
sense.examples: John's house is the most expensive one on the block. She took the dog for a walk around the block after dinner. We had to walk eight blocks to the post office. The fire was about a block from my house. That policeman patrols these blocks of the neighborhood.

sense.name: a number of same objects treated as a unit
sense.examples: They're selling blocks of Red Sox tickets on the Internet. He holds a large block of the company's stock. We tour company has reserved a block of seats for our group. These data blocks are 512 kilobytes in size. The computer scan identified several blocks of bad data on the disk.

sense.name: a housing unit within a larger building
sense.examples: Prisoners were rioting in two cell blocks. There is a block of classrooms in the west wing of the old hall.

sense.name: a mental obstacle
sense.examples: Bob has a mental block when it comes to learning foreign languages. The therapist helped her recognize her emotional blocks with men.

sense.name: a pulley system
sense.examples: He used the mechanical advantage of the block and tackle. These blocks on the sailboat enable you to handle heavy load on the sails.

sense.name: metal casting of an engine
sense.examples: The auto mechanic discovered the engine block was cracked. The pistons of an internal combustion engine are inside the cylinder block.

sense.name: physical obstruction of passage
sense.examples: A block in the artery caused the patient's stroke. The police have set up a block in the road. An ice dam creates a block on the edge of a roof so that melting water pools on the roof instead of flowing off it, leading to leaks in the ceiling.

sense.name: platform for auctions
sense.examples: They've put their paintings on the block. This foreclosed house goes on the auction block next week.

sense.name: the act of obstructing movement or progress
sense.examples: The goalie's block of the kick prevented the offense from scoring. This latest violence is a serious block to negotiations. Her constant and unreasonable demands were a block to the soprano's career. The senator's effective block of the bill angered the president.

sense.name: flat solid areas of color
sense.examples: The abstract painting was a series of overlapping blocks of bright colors. The curtains had blocks of green and yellow in their repeating design.

sense.name: a person's head
sense.examples: The bully threatened to knock his block off. Can't John get it through his block that Mary is my girl.

sense.name: IDIOMS
sense.commentary: BEEN_AROUND_THE_BLOCK (have some experience) NEW_KID_ON_THE_BLOCK (a newcomer to some context) A_CHIP_OFF_THE_OLD_BLOCK (be closely related to an earlier person or thing)
sense.examples: These entrepreneurs have been around the block a few times. (not their first venture) John's the new kid on the block in our department. (a new worker) Bob's father said Bob is just a chip off the old block. (just like his dad)
